headline: Momentum Stock AppLovin Tumbles After Getting Rejected
summary: AppLovin stock fell Monday after failing to get added to the S&P 500 during the index's quarterly rebalancing.

headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Super Micro, Tesla, Nvidia, Palantir, AMD, AppLovin, Hershey, Comcast, and More
summary: Super Micro stock rises after the server maker is granted an extension to file its annual report, Tesla shares fall, and Nvidia declines as China begins an investigation of the chip maker on suspected violation of the country’s anti-monopoly laws.

raw.headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Super Micro, Tesla, Nvidia, Palantir, AMD, AppLovin, Hershey, Comcast, and More
raw.summary: Super Micro stock rises after the server maker is granted an extension to file its annual report, Tesla shares fall, and Nvidia declines as China begins an investigation of the chip maker on suspected violation of the country’s anti-monopoly laws.

headline: AppLovin Stock, Up 775% This Year, Is Tumbling. This Could Be Why.
summary: AppLovin  stock fell sharply Monday after the software company wasn’t added to the  during the index’s quarterly rebalancing.  Shares of  AppLovin  fell 13% to $348.73 and were on track for their lowest same-day percentage decrease since Dec. 6, 2022, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Barron’s reported Friday that the stock was a promising candidate to join the S&P 500, seeing as it boasted one of the largest market values of any companies not included in the index.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Super Micro, Tesla, Workday, AppLovin, Interpublic, and More
summary: Super Micro stock jumps after the server maker is granted an extension to file its annual report, Tesla shares rise to their highest level in nearly three years, and Interpublic surges on a report that says it will be acquired by Omnicom.

headline: AppLovin Stock, Up 750% This Year, Is Tumbling. This Could Be Why.
summary: AppLovin  stock was falling sharply Monday after the software company wasn’t added to the  during the index’s quarterly rebalancing.  Shares of  AppLovin  fell 16% to $338.84 and were on track for their lowest same-day percentage decrease on record, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Barron’s reported Friday that the stock was a promising candidate to join the S&P 500, seeing as it boasted one of the largest market values of any companies not included in the index.

headline: AppLovin (APP) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of mobile app advertising platform AppLovin (NASDAQ: APP) fell 15.9% in the morning session after the company wasn't added to the S&P 500 Index. On Friday, December 6, 2024, markets speculated that AppLovin was a strong contender to join the Index, meeting criteria such as a market value of at least $18 billion and GAAP profitability over the past four quarters. headline: FAD: Growth ETF With Fading Attractiveness
summary: FAD ETF combines a growth strategy with diversification, but lags popular funds due to low liquidity and high fees. Read why FAD is less compelling.
